activities.text: Reflective walk through the ruins of Oradour-sur-Glane, classified as a historic site.

visits.text: Discovery of Lake Chambon, volcanic lake located at the foot of the Sancy massif.

activities.text: Swimming, canoeing or pedal boating on Lake Chambon.
Walk on the beaches and trails around the lake.

visits.text: Exploration of the medieval village of Montpeyroux, classified among the most beautiful villages of France.
Climb to the keep for panorama over the plain of Issoire and the mountains of Auvergne.

activities.text: Stroll through the cobbled streets lined with golden stone houses.

itineraries.title: ESCAPADE IN RHÔNE-ALPES: BETWEEN PERCHED VILLAGES, CAVES AND MOUNTAINS

visits.text: Discovery of the medieval village of Le Poët-Laval, former commandery of the Hospitallers with its castle, the Romanesque chapel of Saint-Jean-des-Commandeurs and the ramparts offering a panoramic view over the Jabron valley.

activities.text: Walk through the cobbled streets and viewpoints over the surrounding lavender fields.

visits.text: Visit to the perched village of Mirmande, classified among the most beautiful villages of France, famous for its cobbled streets, art galleries and stone houses.

activities.text: Discovery of the surrounding orchards and walk to the top of the village to admire the sunset over the Drôme valley.

visits.text: Walk in Old Valence: Saint-Apollinaire Cathedral, Maison des Têtes and place des Clercs.
Discovery of Parc Jouvet and its French and English gardens.

activities.text: Walk on the Champ de Mars and observation of the Kiosque Peynet classified as a historic monument.

visits.text: Exploration of the village of Saint-Antoine-l'Abbaye and its Gothic abbey, one of the most remarkable in Dauphiné.
Discovery of the village of Pont-en-Royans and its colorful houses suspended above the Bourne.

activities.text: Walk in the gorges of the Bourne, panoramic route connecting Pont-en-Royans to Villard-de-Lans.

visits.text: Visit to the Grotte de Choranche, famous for its soda straws and its underground lake with emerald green waters.
Discovery of the city of Annecy: Old Town, canals and Palais de l'Isle.

activities.text: Walk along Lake Annecy and relaxation on the banks of the Pâquier with views of the Alps.

itineraries.title: BETWEEN MONASTERIES, MOUNTAINS AND LAKES: ESCAPADE IN AUVERGNE-RHÔNE-ALPES

visits.text: Discovery of the historic center of Bourg-en-Bresse and its half-timbered houses.
Visit to the Royal Monastery of Brou, a 16th-century flamboyant Gothic masterpiece.

activities.text: Tasting of the famous Bresse poultry in a local restaurant.
Walk in Tête d'Or park to enjoy the green spaces and the local market.

visits.text: Discovery of the old center of Chambéry and its picturesque streets lined with covered passages.
Visit to the Castle of the Dukes of Savoy and the Cathedral of Saint-François-de-Sales.

activities.text: Tasting of chocolate truffles, invented in Chambéry, in an artisanal chocolate shop.
One-hour hike on the trails of the Bauges massif with panoramic view over the valley.

visits.text: Discovery of the thermal center of Aix-les-Bains and its Belle Époque buildings.
Walk along Lake Bourget, the largest natural lake in France.

activities.text: Introduction to paddleboarding on Lake Bourget.
Bike ride on the greenway around the lake, between beaches and forests.

itineraries.title: VOLCANOES AND ALPINE ROADS: 7 DAYS BETWEEN LAKES, FORTRESSES AND GORGES

visits.text: Chamonix: stroll in the historic center at the foot of Mont-Blanc.
Chamonix Alpine Museum: collections on mountaineering and first ascents.
Yvoire: medieval town on the shores of Lake Geneva, discovery of the fortified alleys.
Garden of the Five Senses in Yvoire: sensory trail organized by themes.

activities.text: Aiguille du Midi cable car: panoramic ascent over the Mont-Blanc massif.
Panoramic transfer Chamonix → Yvoire along Lake Geneva (viewpoint stops).

visits.text: Annecy: old town, canals and Pont des Amours.
Annecy: Palais de l'Isle (exterior and museography).
Aix-les-Bains: Belle Époque stroll between casino, thermal baths and Lake Bourget esplanade.

activities.text: Annecy: Pâquier promenade and partial lake tour (pedestrian/bike).
Annecy: mini-cruise on the lake (depending on season).

visits.text: Chambéry: Château of the Dukes of Savoy (courtyards and exteriors).
Chambéry: Museum of Fine Arts (Italian and Savoyard collections).
Grenoble: old center and banks of the Isère.
Grenoble: Grenoble Museum (ancient to contemporary art).

activities.text: Grenoble: cable car bubbles up to Fort de la Bastille and panorama over the mountain ranges.

visits.text: Lyon: Old Lyon (UNESCO), Saint-Jean Cathedral and Renaissance districts.
Lyon: Notre-Dame de Fourvière basilica and belvedere.
Lyon: Presqu'île, Place Bellecour and the Rhône/Saône quays.

activities.text: Lyon: self-guided tour through the traboules (historic passages).

visits.text: Vercors: Bourne gorges, belvederes and geological points of interest.
Passerelle du Drac (Himalayan bridge): crossing and viewpoints over the Drac.

activities.text: Vercors scenic route (cliffs, tunnels and combes).
Short hike around Villard-de-Lans (alpine pastures and limestone pavements).

visits.text: Pont d'Arc: viewpoint of the natural arch and gorge belvederes.
Chauvet Cave 2 (replica): cave art collection and scientific mediation.

activities.text: Gentle descent of the Ardèche gorges by kayak (short section, weather permitting).
Scenic viewpoints route of the gorges: successive stops for panoramas.

visits.text: Nyons: old bridge (Roman bridge) and banks of the Eygues.
Nyons: Tour Randonne and panorama over the Drôme provençale.
Historic center of Nyons: small squares, arcades and mills (exterior).

activities.text: Olive-growing walk around Nyons: path between olive groves and dry stone walls.

itineraries.title: ROAD TRIP FROM BORDEAUX TO TOULOUSE: BETWEEN OCEAN, MOUNTAINS AND HERITAGE

visits.text: Discovery of the historic center of Bordeaux, UNESCO World Heritage listed.
Stroll on the place des Quinconces, the largest square in Europe.
Walk along the quays of the Garonne and visit to the Miroir d'eau.

activities.text: Wine tasting at the Cité du Vin museum.

visits.text: Ascent of the Dune du Pilat, the highest dune in Europe.
Walk along the Arcachon seafront and in the Ville d'Hiver district.

activities.text: Cruise in the Arcachon basin to observe the tchanquées huts and Bird Island.

visits.text: Discovery of the surf beaches of Hossegor and Capbreton.
Walk around Lake Hossegor and the typical Landes villas.

activities.text: Surf initiation on one of the legendary beaches of the Atlantic coast.

visits.text: Discovery of the town of Saint-Jean-de-Luz and its fishing port.
Excursion to Sare to take the Rhune train to the summit.

activities.text: Panoramic observation of the Pyrenees and the Basque coast from the summit of La Rhune.

visits.text: Discovery of downtown Dax and its arena.
Visit to the Borda museum and Gallo-Roman remains.

activities.text: Discovery of the thermal culture of Dax, the largest thermal resort in France.

visits.text: Walk in the historic center of Tarbes, around the town hall and fountains.
Excursion to Lourdes to visit the Notre-Dame sanctuary and the Grotto of Massabielle.

activities.text: Relaxation in the Massey gardens and visit to the Hussars museum.

visits.text: Discovery of the Capitole de Toulouse and the main square.
Visit to the Saint-Sernin basilica and the Jacobins convent.
Stroll along the Garonne and the lively quays.

activities.text: Discovery of the Aéroscopia museum and the Cité de l'Espace.

itineraries.title: HIDDEN VILLAGES OF MIDI-PYRÉNÉES: BASTIDES, CLIFFS AND ABBEYS

visits.text: Cordes-sur-Ciel — ascent through the Porte des Ormeaux and crossing of Gothic streets (Houses of the Grand Veneur, of the Grand Écuyer).
Saint-Michel Church of Cordes — southern Gothic nave and sculpted portal.
Najac — stroll through the medieval town among half-timbered houses and artisan shops.

activities.text: Royal Castle of Najac — climb to the keep and panorama over the Aveyron valley.
Saint-Jean Church of Najac — visit of the late Romanesque decoration.

visits.text: Route Najac → Saint-Cirq-Lapopie through valleys and gorges — photo stops on viewpoints.
Saint-Cirq-Lapopie — climb through the cobbled streets, corbelled houses and art workshops.
Church of Saint-Cirq-Lapopie — forecourt as viewpoint over the Lot valley.

activities.text: Viewpoints of Saint-Cirq (high viewpoint) — sunset photo session.
Short walk on the towpath (Bouziès, section carved into the rock) — easy round trip.

visits.text: Saint-Cirq-Lapopie — last view from the top of the village.
Rocamadour — Religious city clinging to the cliff: small square, pilgrims' stairway, chapels.
Sanctuaries of Rocamadour — discovery of the Black Virgin and troglodytic chapels.

activities.text: Way of the Cross to Rocamadour castle — panorama over the Alzou canyon.
L'Hospitalet viewpoint — overall view of the site.

visits.text: Rocamadour — tour of the castle ramparts (exterior) and lower streets.
Autoire — village of blonde stone houses at the foot of the cirque.

activities.text: Autoire waterfall — walking loop to the falls (short round trip).
Cornices of the Autoire cirque — viewpoints (one way from the village).
Site of the "châteaux des Anglais" (troglodytic shelters, view from the path).

visits.text: Route Autoire → Conques — countryside crossing and valleys of Aveyron, photo stops.
Conques — medieval town on the Dourdou, half-timbered houses and sloping alleyways.
Sainte-Foy Abbey Church — Last Judgment tympanum, stained glass windows by Pierre Soulages.

activities.text: Treasure of Conques — medieval goldsmithery (reliquary of Saint Foy).
Pilgrims' Bridge (called "Roman") — walk along the Dourdou and views of the abbey.

itineraries.title: COASTAL NORMANDY IN 10 DAYS: CLIFFS, PORTS, D-DAY LANDING AND MONT BAY

visits.text: Étretat — seafront and old bunker (reading history panels)
Étretat — Aval cliff hike (needle + Manneporte, round trip from the beach)
Étretat — Amont cliff and Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde chapel (viewpoint)
Étretat — Gardens of Étretat (art & landscape, panorama)
Veules-les-Roses — Circuit of the smallest river in France (watering trough, Saint-Martin church, mills)
Veules-les-Roses — Seafront and esplanade inspired by the liner "Normandie"
Veules-les-Roses — Climb up the cliffs (view of beach and rooftops)

activities.text: Étretat — belvedere stop for photos above the needle
Veules-les-Roses — stroll through the pedestrian streets and turrets

visits.text: Honfleur — Rue des Petites Boucheries, Rue de la Prison, Vieux-Bassin (heritage ensemble)
Honfleur — Sainte-Catherine Church (wooden nave) and separate bell tower
Honfleur — Notre-Dame-de-Grâce Chapel (view over the estuary)
Honfleur — Panorama from Mont Joli (view of Normandy Bridge)
Trouville-sur-Mer — center and quays (half-timbered buildings, ND-des-Victoires)

activities.text: Honfleur — tour of the Vieux-Bassin at sunset (photos)
Deauville — barefoot walk on the sand (depending on tide)

visits.text: Le Havre — Hanging Gardens (fort, greenhouses, panorama of city & sea)
Le Havre — Seafront (cabins, UP#3 sculpture, large ships)
Le Havre — Saint-Joseph Church (lantern tower, Perret architecture)
Le Havre — Notre-Dame Cathedral (facade, pre-Perret survivor)
Le Havre — Container Chain (port, colorful installation)
Le Havre — Downtown: Le Volcan, François-Le-Chevalier footbridge, Bassin du Commerce
Le Havre — "Narrow House" (Erwin Wurm) — Claude-Érignac square

activities.text: Le Havre — sunset stroll on the beach (pebbles)

visits.text: Colleville-sur-Mer — American Cemetery (promenade overlooking Omaha, memorial, chapel)
Overlord Museum (around Omaha) — June 6th operations and staged equipment

activities.text: Bessin region — guided tour of an artisanal cider house (orchard, press, cellar)

visits.text: Barfleur — port, Saint-Nicolas church, granite alleyways
Saint-Vaast-la-Hougue — port and Vauban tower (UNESCO, from the coast)
Tatihou Island — maritime museum (by amphibious shuttle and schedules)

activities.text: Saint-Vaast — dike promenade & observation of oyster parks at low tide

visits.text: Nez de Jobourg — coastal path (cliff and cape panoramas)
Goury — la Hague lighthouse (view from the coast) and shelter port
Biville Dunes — walk on dune ridge and wild beach

activities.text: Cap de la Hague — successive viewpoints (photo stops)

visits.text: Cap de Carteret — promontory, semaphore and customs officers' path
Carteret Lighthouse — belvedere over dunes and haven

activities.text: Hattainville Dunes — free walk (sand and marram grass loop)

visits.text: Mont-Saint-Michel — Abbey (interior route with audio guide)
Mont Bay — viewpoints dike and footbridge (depending on tide)

activities.text: Shuttles/on foot — footbridge crossing and photo session (tide rises/falls)

visits.text: Villedieu-les-Poêles — copper workshops and artisan streets
Mortain-Bocage — Grande Cascade and Petite Cascade (short loop)

activities.text: Mortain — viewpoint over the bocage (photo stop)

visits.text: Granville — fortified Upper Town (ramparts, gate, narrow streets)
Granville — Pointe du Roc (semaphore, panorama Chausey islands in the distance)
Granville — Richard-Anacréon Modern Art Museum (collection and exhibition)
Granville — Christian Dior Museum (Les Rhumbs villa, gardens) — depending on opening

activities.text: Granville — walk on the dike and Plat Gousset beach

itineraries.title: PYRÉNÉES-ATLANTIQUES: BÉARN & BASQUE COUNTRY BETWEEN PASSES, GORGES AND OCEAN

visits.text: Col d'Aubisque (1709 m): 360° panorama and orientation table at the summit.
Gourette: discovery of the resort and Bézou plateau (access by cable car in summer).
Lac de Bious-Artigues: easy loop along the lake with views of Pic du Midi d'Ossau.

activities.text: Aubisque → trail towards the ridge (Grum ridge type route) for extended viewpoints.
Gourette: mountain biking on dedicated trails (summer).
Bious-Artigues: family hike and supervised water activities (canoe/horseback riding depending on season).

visits.text: Village of Lescun: narrow streets, church, panorama of the cirque from the kiosk.
Lescun Belvedere: viewpoint over the cirque after gradual ascent.
Sanchèse Plateau: easy walk in a pastoral valley with waterfall at the back of the cirque.

activities.text: Belvedere hike (round trip ~2 h, ~300 m elevation gain), vulture observation depending on conditions.
Sanchèse Plateau: continue to the foot of the waterfall and nature break.

visits.text: Chemin de la Mature (Gorges d'Enfer): trail carved into the cliff face, views over the Aspe valley.
Fort du Portalet: fortified complex clinging to the rock face (access by guided tour).
Oloron-Sainte-Marie: Sainte-Marie cathedral, Sainte-Croix church, bridges over the Gave, city center.

activities.text: Variant from the start of Chemin de la Mature: round trip to Portalet via the footbridge (if visit reserved).

visits.text: Holzarte Footbridge: forest hike to the suspension bridge above the gorges.
Saint-Palais: town center, fronton, banks of Bédouze, Saint-Paul and Sainte-Madeleine churches.

activities.text: Holzarte: continuation after the footbridge on balcony trail (depending on level), exploration of clearings and pools.

visits.text: Biarritz: promenade from the Lighthouse (Pointe Saint-Martin) to Rocher de la Vierge, beaches and cliffs.
Anglet: seafront between Chambre d'Amour and Barre de l'Adour.
Bidart: center and coastal viewpoints; passage to Uhabia beach.

activities.text: Surfing or bodyboarding introduction on supervised beach (conditions and season permitting).
Sunset at Uhabia: coastal walk and wave observation.

visits.text: Espelette: traditional streets and facades, old castle, Saint-Étienne church, covered market.
Basque Corniche – Domaine d'Abbadia (Hendaye): coastal path and sculpted cliffs.

activities.text: Summit of Mondarrain (from Espelette/Itxassou): panoramic hike (moderate level).
Scenic road climb to Artzamendi: photo stops and short walk on the ridges.

visits.text: Fort de Socoa (Ciboure): defensive complex on the bay shore.
Ciboure: Saint-Vincent church, market and old fountain; stroll through the town.
Saint-Jean-de-Luz: large beach, jetty, port and historic center.
Pointe de Sainte-Barbe: landscaped park and panorama over the bay.

activities.text: Gentle coastal walk between Ciboure, Socoa and Saint-Jean-de-Luz (round trip depending on time).

itineraries.title: THE GREAT SPA ROUTE — JOURNEY TO THE HEART OF PYRENEAN WELLNESS

visits.text: Discovery of the Louron valley and Lake Génos-Loudenvielle, surrounded by verdant peaks.
Walk through the typical village of Loudenvielle, between traditional architecture and mountain atmosphere.

activities.text: Wellness session at Balnéa, thermal center with Roman, Japanese and Amerindian baths.
Evening walk around the lake to admire the sunset over the Pyrénées.

visits.text: Stroll through the village of Saint-Lary-Soulan, renowned for its friendly atmosphere and stone chalets.
Exploration of the landscapes of the Aure valley, in the heart of the Pyrénées National Park.

activities.text: Relaxing moment at Sensoria Rio: bubble beds, massage jets and panoramic hammam.
Access to the Sensoria wellness area with jacuzzi, sauna and mountain views.

visits.text: Crossing the Aspin pass, famous Pyrénées route offering spectacular panoramas.
Discovery of Bagnères-de-Bigorre, charming spa town at the foot of Pic du Midi.

activities.text: Relaxing experience at Aquensis: bubbling lagoons and oriental hammam under monumental framework.
Walk through the historic center of Bagnères and its local market.

visits.text: Ascent of the Col du Tourmalet, a cycling mecca and gateway to Pyrenean panoramas.
Cable car ascent to Pic du Midi de Bigorre from La Mongie.

activities.text: Relaxation session at the Ciéléo center in Barèges: 34° baths under a glass dome, panoramic jacuzzi and geysers.

visits.text: Discovery of the Pays Toy and its authentic villages with stone houses.
Stroll through the center of Luz-Saint-Sauveur, a lively thermal village.

activities.text: Moment of relaxation at Luzéa: Roman baths, oriental hammam and suspended jacuzzi.

visits.text: Exploration of the Pont d'Espagne and surrounding waterfalls in the Pyrénées National Park.
Stroll through the village of Cauterets, a thermal resort with Belle Époque charm.

activities.text: Relaxation at the Bains du Rocher: outdoor pools, hammams, mother-of-pearl mosaics and refined atmosphere.

visits.text: Discovery of the medieval village of Saint-Savin and its Benedictine abbey overlooking the valley.
Walk in the Val d'Azun and observation of preserved landscapes.

activities.text: Sensory experience at the Jardins des Bains: Babylon hammams, Emerald Forest and Mesopotamian Ziggurat.

itineraries.title: ESSENTIAL ARIÈGE: CASTLES, CAVES, LAKES AND PEAKS

visits.text: Stroll in Foix: old streets, half-timbered facades and Saint-Volusien abbey church.
Immersive visit of Foix Castle (towers, siege machines, workshops).
Discovery of the Forges de Pyrène (old crafts) in Montgailhard.

activities.text: Castle workshops (forge, medieval weapons, stone cutting).

visits.text: Mirepoix: medieval city, Maison des Consuls, place des Couverts and Sainte-Maurice cathedral.
Le Vernet: La Belle Verte leisure base (launch on the Ariège).
Montségur: ascent to the pog and discovery of the castle (sunrise/sunset slot possible).

activities.text: Stand Up Paddle in whitewater (Le Vernet → Saverdun approx. 8 km) with supervision.
Final approach walk to Montségur castle (steep slope, developed trail).

visits.text: Niaux Cave: guided tour to the Black Room (paleolithic paintings).
Lombrives Cave: Keel, Amphitheater and Great Cemetery Gallery.

activities.text: Approach on foot/mini-train to the Lombrives entrance then visit in small group.

visits.text: Panoramic route D8/D18 to Étang de Lers (regional natural park).
Étang de Lers: walk along the lake shore and viewpoint of the Trois-Seigneurs peak.
Arrival in Aulus-les-Bains, mountain thermal village.
Round-trip hike to Cascade d'Ars from Aulus (outbound ~4 km, +500 m).
Option: loop via Étang de Guzet (extends the hike).

activities.text: Photo break and wildlife observation (raptors, possible isards) around the col d'Agnès/plateau de Lers.
Picnic at the foot of the waterfall (weather permitting) and return via the GR10.

visits.text: Lake Bethmale: tour of the lake, walkways and emerald-colored viewpoints.
Stop in Saint-Girons: old bridge and banks of the Salat (depending on timing).

activities.text: Forest walk around the lake and quiet time by the water.

itineraries.title: ANTIQUE AND PROVENÇAL ROAD TRIP: BETWEEN ROMAN VESTIGES AND SOUTHERN VILLAGES

visits.text: Discovery of the Pont du Gard, masterpiece of Roman engineering listed as UNESCO World Heritage.
Stroll through the historic center of Uzès, France's first duchy, and visit of the Fenestrelle tower.

activities.text: Walk along the Gardon and viewpoints of the aqueduct from the panoramic trails.

visits.text: Discovery of the ancient Theatre of Orange, inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage list.
Passage under the Arc de Triomphe of Orange and stroll through the historic center.

activities.text: Option: visit to the Art and History museum tracing Gallo-Roman life.

visits.text: Visit to the Arena of Nîmes, a remarkably well-preserved Roman amphitheater.
Discovery of the Maison Carrée and the Museum of Romanity.

activities.text: Stroll through the Jardins de la Fontaine and climb the Tour Magne for the view over the city.

visits.text: Exploration of the Arena of Arles and the ancient theater.
Walk through the historic center and discovery of the Saint-Trophime cloister.

activities.text: Visit to the Arles Antique departmental museum to complete the Roman discovery.

visits.text: Visit to the archaeological site of Glanum, ancient Roman city buried at the foot of the Alpilles.
Discovery of the center of Saint-Rémy-de-Provence and its Provençal streets.

activities.text: Walk in the Alpilles to the Antiques of Saint-Rémy, two isolated Roman monuments.

itineraries.title: LANGUEDOC-ROUSSILLON: SEA, VINEYARDS & CITADELS — THE GRAND TOUR

visits.text: Nîmes Arena: discovery of the Roman amphitheater and panorama over the city.
Maison Carrée and Carré d'Art: Roman temple and contemporary architecture face to face.
Gardens of the Fountain and Tour Magne: historical walk to the belvedere.

activities.text: Guided walk in the old center of Nîmes (pedestrian streets, private mansions).
Introduction to Roman archaeology at the Museum of Romanity (permanent exhibition).

visits.text: Bamboo Grove in Cévennes at Anduze: botanical park (Sequoia avenue, Japanese garden).
Steam train of the Cévennes (option) between Anduze and Saint-Jean-du-Gard.

activities.text: Stroll through Anduze: pottery and artisan workshops.
Short Cevennes loop on trail (nearby viewpoint) for views over the valleys.

visits.text: Ramparts of Aigues-Mortes and Tower of Constance.
Petite Camargue: ponds, salt marshes and flamingo watching.

activities.text: Sunset at Étang du Ponant (photo walk).
Nature outing with Camargue guide (horses, herds; respectful observation).

visits.text: Pont du Gard: crossing the site and viewpoints over the ancient aqueduct.
Uzès: duchy, arcaded squares and medieval streets.

activities.text: Swimming/relaxing by the Gardon River (depending on season) below the aqueduct.
Gourmet walk at Uzès market (dates according to calendar).

visits.text: Gévaudan Wolf Park (Sainte-Lucie, near Marvejols): observation trail.
Segment of the Stevenson Trail (GR70) around Florac/Barre-des-Cévennes: ridge walking.

activities.text: Reading the Cévennes landscapes: schist, chestnut groves, drailles.
Evening stroll in Mende: cathedral and Notre-Dame bridge.

visits.text: Lérab Ling Temple (Roqueredonde): Tibetan architecture and large Buddha.
Pic Saint-Loup: viewpoints (access via belvederes; complete ascent optional).
Cirque de Mourèze and Salagou lake: landscapes of dolomitic rocks and red earth.
Lauriole curiosity (near Minerve, Hérault): optical illusion road.

activities.text: Saint-Guilhem-le-Désert & Pont du Diable: walk from cloister through the Hérault gorges.
Buèges Valley: refreshing break by the water (depending on season).

visits.text: City of Carcassonne: ramparts, Saint-Nazaire basilica and comtal castle.
Châteaux de Lastours (or Peyrepertuse/Quéribus depending on weather): "citadels of vertigo".

activities.text: Twilight stroll on the lists of the city (without crowds).
Discovery of the Corbières landscapes from a Cathar belvedere.

visits.text: Canal du Midi: section between Carcassonne and Castelnaudary (by bike or on foot).
Locks and engineering works (Saint-Roch lock): observation of barges passing through.

activities.text: Shaded stroll along the plane trees of the canal; reading break.
Local tastings (e.g. lingot beans/Limoux AOP at local produce shop).

visits.text: Yellow train of the Pyrenees: emblematic journey Villefranche-de-Conflent → Latour-de-Carol (recommended section).
Villefranche-de-Conflent: Vauban ramparts and medieval alleyways.

activities.text: Return to the sea: late afternoon stroll on the seafront of Collioure.
Sunset at the foot of the royal castle and bell tower.

visits.text: Côte Vermeille: Collioure, Port-Vendres, Banyuls and coastal path.
Cerbère-Banyuls marine reserve: seabed observation (snorkeling depending on conditions).

activities.text: Artistic walk following the Fauvist trail (viewpoints and reproductions).
Beach or cove at midday (swimming depending on season).

visits.text: Montpellier: Écusson, place de la Comédie, medical school, medieval Mikvé (depending on availability).
Wine route: Pic Saint-Loup/Grès de Montpellier — winery stops (responsible tastings).

activities.text: Peyrou Park & Saint-Clément aqueduct: panoramic walk.
Designer urban tram: mini-journey to read the contemporary city.

visits.text: Mediterranean coast on the Hérault side: Grande-Motte/Palavas or Espiguette beach (choice depending on wind).
Sète (option): Mont Saint-Clair and canals, views over the Thau lagoon.

activities.text: Bike ride on coastal paths (secured section).
Introduction to oyster farming on the Thau lagoon (subject to availability).

itineraries.title: ROAD TRIP BETWEEN PERCHED VILLAGES, SPECTACULAR GORGES AND TREASURES OF THE SOUTHEAST

visits.text: Discovery of the classified village of Auvillar and its circular 18th-century market hall.

activities.text: Walk along the Garonne and observation of the panorama over the valley.

visits.text: Stroll through the cobbled streets of Saint-Cirq-Lapopie, classified among the most beautiful villages in France.

activities.text: Observation of the panorama over the Lot valley at sunset.

visits.text: Exploration of the historic center of Albi and the Sainte-Cécile cathedral.
Visit to the Toulouse-Lautrec museum in the former episcopal palace.

activities.text: Walk along the banks of the Tarn and view of the old bridge.

visits.text: Ascent to Cordes-sur-Ciel, medieval city with cobblestone streets and artisan workshops.
Discovery of the Roquefort aging caves in Roquefort-sur-Soulzon.

visits.text: Village on the banks of the Isère; church and former boatmen's town.
Quays and views of mills and riverside gardens.

activities.text: Loop of quays and nearby hamlets (2–3 km).
Path to riverside viewpoints for reading the river.

visits.text: Town squeezed between Bourne and Isère; sloping alleys and water viewpoints.
Structures on the Bourne and panorama over the Vercors foothills.

activities.text: Riverside route and footbridges (2 km, flat).
Short climb to a high point over the Royans.

visits.text: Houses suspended above the Bourne; bridge and castle remains.
Medieval heart sloping down to the quays, colorful facades.
Entrance to the Bourne gorges, limestone cliffs.

activities.text: Exploration trail at the foot of the cliffs (round trip, secured).

visits.text: Hamlet at the foot of the Presles cliffs; springs and Bourne waterfall.
Natural belvederes over limestone cirques and striated walls.

activities.text: Balcony trail overlooking the valley (3–5 km, marked aerial passages).

visits.text: Valley village at the mouth of the Bourne gorges; scattered settlement and meadows.
Chapel and hamlets with views over the wooded ridges.

activities.text: Hamlets and clearings loop (4–6 km, low elevation gain).
Round trip to a belvedere over the gorge.

visits.text: Mountain village heart; squares, galleries and high rooftops.
Views of the plateau and cliffs of Grande Moucherolle.

activities.text: Urban loop and balcony path (3–4 km).
Walk along the edge toward alpine meadows.

visits.text: Valley village of Autrans-Méaudre; aligned chalets and grassy squares.
Church, gallery farms and scattered hamlets.

activities.text: Gentle valley bottom loop (5–7 km, flat).
Short climb along the edge for panorama over the combes.

visits.text: Mountain town; houses grouped around the church and market.
Plateau meadows and forests; trail and path starting points.

activities.text: Easy forest loop to the clearings (4–6 km).
Heritage trail of the center and old farms.

visits.text: Gateway village to the plateau; shopping streets and mountain architecture.
Panoramas of the eastern ridges and valleys.

activities.text: Balcony path above the town (3–4 km).
Walk to a viewpoint over the Grenoble cluse.

visits.text: High plateau village; scattered settlements and vast alpine grasslands.
Viewpoints of the southern ridges of Vercors.

activities.text: Plateau loop on white trails (6–8 km, very gentle slope).
Landscape reading of combes and karst at the edge.

visits.text: Central town of the Drôme Vercors; village square and radiating streets.
Meadows and wooded foothills surrounding the basin.

activities.text: Climb to a high point for views over the basin.

visits.text: Valley village nestled at the foot of the ridges; church and adjacent hamlets.
Meadows and streams at the bottom of the valley, views of the cliffs.

activities.text: Hamlets and stream banks loop (3–4 km).

visits.text: Alpine village south of the plateau; chalets, small squares and stone walls.
Clearings and trail starts toward the high valleys.

activities.text: Panoramic loop at the edge of the Hauts-Plateaux (6–8 km).
Heritage trail in the village: roofs with stone slabs and wooden shingles.

itineraries.title: AUTHENTIC AUVERGNE: PERCHED VILLAGES AND VOLCANIC VALLEYS IN LOGICAL SEQUENCE

visits.text: Fortified village clinging to a basaltic spur above the nascent Loire; remains of the county castle.
Romanesque church and successive viewpoints over the deep gorges.
Route through paved alleyways revealing low walls and lava stone houses.

activities.text: Arlempdes gorges loop (3-4 km, balcony passages).
Volcanic landscape reading from the summit esplanade.

visits.text: Former stronghold of the Régordane at over 1,000 m; gates, ramparts and notable residences.
Windy small squares and views over the Devès plateau and Lake Naussac.
Medieval layout with narrow alleyways and basalt staircases.

activities.text: Heritage walk within the walls and tour of the ramparts (2–3 km).
Panoramic round trip to a viewpoint overlooking the Margeride.

visits.text: Village perched on the gorges of the Couze Pavin; castle and medieval paintings.
Wash houses, old bridge and cliff-top paths above the river.
Mineral spring and surrounding archaeological remains.

activities.text: Couze gorges trail (3–5 km, moderate elevation change).
Observation route of volcanic architecture and corbelling.

visits.text: Labeled town at the foot of a feudal castle; remarkable Auvergne Romanesque church.
Cobbled streets, winegrowers' houses and old gates.
Terraced gardens with views over the Monne valley.

activities.text: Hillside path towards a wine-growing belvedere nearby.

visits.text: Basalt town at the foot of the Bredons and Bonnevie rocks; stone slab houses and radiating alleyways.
Saint-Pierre de Bredons church perched, panorama over the Alagnon valley.
Place du Balat and medieval facades.

activities.text: Ascent to Bredons rock via paved path (2 km round trip).
Urban route of portals, shops and mascarons.

visits.text: Schist and lava village dominated by Anjony castle; housing clustered on spur.
Sunken alleyways and small squares on terraces.
Panoramas over the Cantal mountains and bocage valleys.

activities.text: Loop of the viewpoints above the Doire (3–4 km).
Survey of traditional buildings: stone slab roofing, andesite frameworks.

visits.text: Perched village with dark lava stone houses, ramparts and gates; central square lined with mansions.
Saint-Mathieu Church and sloping streets toward the suburbs.
High points on the puys and pastures of the High Plateau.

activities.text: Salers hill loop (3–5 km) with views over the Maronne valley.
Heritage route within the walls and reading of turrets and watchtowers.

visits.text: Old center crossed by the Lauter, half-timbered houses and old city gates.
Abbey church of Saints-Pierre-et-Paul, great Gothic nave at the heart of the village.
Ramparts district and walkways along the water.

activities.text: Pedestrian loop of the ramparts and canals (3–4 km).
Gentle climb to viewpoints for panoramas over the Palatinate forest.

visits.text: Half-timbered village lined along the main street and typical white farms.
Church and grassy squares, covered wells and washhouse.
Open landscapes of the Outre-Forêt and historic agricultural paths.

activities.text: Country walk towards forest edges (4–6 km).

visits.text: Historic center and central market surrounded by timber-framed houses.
Preserved ramparts and towers, gateway to the Bas-Rhin vineyard.
Town Hall Square and monumental fountains.

activities.text: Intra-muros circuit of squares and ramparts (3 km).
Wine trail on a balcony above the city (2–3 km).

visits.text: Sandstone village and Renaissance houses around courtyards and wine presses.
Cobbled alleys leading to the wine terraces of Zellberg.
Civil and religious buildings soberly decorated.

activities.text: Wine trail loop and hillside viewpoint (3–4 km).
Architectural identification of dated lintels and cart porches.

visits.text: Medieval town surrounded by complete ramparts, washhouses and fountains.
Cobbled streets and flowered facades typical of the wine route.

activities.text: Wine trail on the immediate outskirts of the village.

visits.text: Grand'rue lined with winegrowers' houses and successive fountains.
Panoramas over the three castles dominating the vineyard.

activities.text: Connecting path to a belvedere overlooking the castles (2–3 km round trip).
Heritage trail of the signs and bay windows of Grand'rue.

visits.text: Fortified church on its hillock, surrounded by vineyards in an amphitheater.
Narrow streets and half-timbered houses of the lower village.

activities.text: Loop of vineyard stone walls and wayside crosses (3–4 km).
Climb to the walled cemetery for landscape reading.

visits.text: Village perched on viticultural hill, curved lanes and closely-packed houses.
Church and summit square with views over the Alsace plain.
Traces of the old fortified layout.

activities.text: Hill contour path and viewpoints (2–3 km).
Historical route of the upper town and old moats.

visits.text: Cobbled main street leading to the Dolder tower, colorful houses with corbelling.
Successive enclosures and gates, transverse alleys towards the ramparts.
Wine districts in contact with planted hills.

activities.text: Photographic survey of emblematic facade decorations and bay windows.

visits.text: Fortified bridge over the Weiss and row of half-timbered houses.
Castle on the heights and views over the vineyard.

activities.text: Ascent to the castle via the forest path (2 km round trip).
Urban loop along the Weiss and small squares.

visits.text: Porte de France and well-preserved walls, center grouped around the church.
Winegrowers' quarter and lanes toward the hills.
Houses with colorful roofs visible from the town entrances.

activities.text: Ramparts and medieval gates circuit (2–3 km).
Wine trail to the neighboring hillsides (3–4 km).

visits.text: Vosges valley center, tree-lined squares and major religious buildings.
Banks of the Fecht and landscaped parks.
Remains of the former abbey and historic quarter.

activities.text: Park-to-park walk along the Fecht (3–4 km).
Gentle climb on a hillside path for an overview of the valley.

visits.text: Concentric rings of ramparts around the central square and fountain.
Half-timbered houses clustered along circular streets.
Remains of towers and access gates.

activities.text: Complete circular route of the inner ramparts (2–3 km).
Vineyard path towards the sandstone hills (3–4 km).

visits.text: Fortified town with octagonal plan designed under Louis XIV, bastions and monumental gates.
Orthogonal central street and regular alignments.
Ramparts and glacis offering views over the Rhine and the plain.

activities.text: Complete tour of the ramparts on developed walkway (5–6 km, flat).
Reading of the star-shaped plan from an exterior viewpoint.

visits.text: Borough at the foot of the castle ruins of the counts; stairs and narrow passages.
Church and Town Hall at the center of the small valley of the Alsatian Jura.
Belvedere beneath the walls offering a reading of the Sundgau relief.

activities.text: Access path to the castle and viewpoint loop (3–4 km, elevation change).
Route through the lower streets and former moats of the town.

visits.text: Restored medieval city on a rocky spur; cobbled streets and houses attached to the ramparts.
Remains of the fortress castle dominating the valley, belvederes over the Rhône and the neighboring massif.
Romanesque church and small oratories integrated into the ancient fabric.

activities.text: Heritage loop in the upper town and ramparts path (2–3 km).
Valley floor walk to the foot of the rock for reading the castle site.

visits.text: Pont d'Arc, monumental natural arch opening the Ardèche gorges.
Historic center and traces of the town's former commercial activity.
Viewpoints over the river and reading of limestone strata.

activities.text: Approach walk to the viewpoints of Pont d'Arc (3–4 km round trip).
Left bank route on marked trail outside sensitive areas.

visits.text: Old shaded streets and small squares with stone houses.
Route des Défilés: limestone corridor carved into the rock (viewpoints).

activities.text: Pedestrian loop within the walls with survey of defensive elements.
Panoramic stops along the Défilés (car circuit with walking access).

visits.text: Village on the Beaume; pebble houses and vaulted passages.
Stone bridge and esplanades along the riverbank.
Church and high points on the Beaume loop.

activities.text: Labeaume belvedere trail (3–5 km, stairs and developed ledges).
Waterside walk along the bank, observation of pebbles and riparian forest.

visits.text: Village perched on the cliffside, winding streets and medieval arcades.
Bridge over the Ardèche with plunging views of the beach and meanders.
Remains of the ramparts and covered passages toward the upper town.

activities.text: Cobbled ascent to the summit belvedere and descent through narrow lanes (2–3 km).
Landscape reading from the bridge: cliffs, limestone banks and valley confluence.

visits.text: Village clinging to the rock; Saint-Barthélémy chapel and tower of the old castle.
Medieval vestiges emerging along the narrow alleyways.
Hamlet of Sauveplantade nearby, Romanesque micro-heritage.

activities.text: Short loop around the rocky peak (2–3 km) with interpretation stops.
Wandering through the upper/lower alleyways to read the settlement on the rocky ridge.

visits.text: Amphitheater village on the Ardèche, at the foot of the château of the Lords of Vogüé.
Quays and alleyways backed against the cliff, pierced with vaulted passages.
High belvederes with views over the enclosed watercourse.

activities.text: Route through terraces and lanes to the waterfront (2 km).
Spotting viewpoints on the right bank/left bank for panoramic shots.

visits.text: Forest village with scattered hamlets; Romanesque church in the mineral heart.
Small squares and stone houses in a network of narrow streets.
Edges of maritime pines and low walls bordering old paths.

activities.text: Hamlets loop (4–6 km) between undergrowth and clearings.
Heritage route around the church and sundials.

visits.text: Highest perched village in the area; castle remains and circular panorama.
Ancient enclosure and clustered habitat on the edge of the basaltic plateau.
Church square and views over the Coiron and distant Cévennes.

activities.text: Ridge path on the edge of the Coiron (3–5 km).
Geological reading: basaltic flows, organ pipes and plateaus.

visits.text: Two-colored village with basalt-limestone checkerboard facades; carved doors and lintels.
Ancient vestiges of the Gallo-Roman capital on the periphery (exterior panoramas).
Cobbled alleys and vaulted passages behind the old fortifications.

activities.text: Village loop between ramparts and lower districts (2–3 km).
Interpretation route around ancient traces (self-guided tour).

visits.text: Medieval village on Tanargue foothills; keep and church overlooking the valley.
Network of alleys and stone-paved paths connecting the upper town to the terraces.

activities.text: Round trip to the high point for panorama and survey of the terrace network.
Short heritage loop within the enclosure and suburbs (2 km).

visits.text: Village within a landscape of vineyards, scrubland and low woods.
Chapel and traces of the ancient priory, rural micro-heritage.
Network of paths bordered by low stone walls and stone piles.

activities.text: Rural loop 5–7 km between vineyards and open oak groves.
Hamlet route for reading traditional buildings.

visits.text: Cévenol village on a balcony; remains of the castle and parish church.
Route between the two market towns and cultivated terraces.
Dolmens and evidence of ancient occupation on the neighboring plateau.

activities.text: Panoramic loop around the castle hill (3–4 km).
Terraces and stone piles route on the edge of garrigue.

visits.text: Village of character at the gates of Cévennes National Park; clustered houses and cobbled streets.
Church and shaded squares, views over the valleys of Chassezac.
Remains of the enclosure and passages under arches.

activities.text: Discovery loop of the old town and nearby viewpoints (2–3 km).
Walk towards the faïsses and traditional terraced crops.

visits.text: Picturesque hamlet at the bottom of a wild valley; stone slab roofs and narrow streets.
Romanesque church perched above the torrent, mineral viewpoint.
Passages on slabs and stairs clinging to the slope.

activities.text: Balcony trail above the thalweg (3–5 km, elevation gain).
Route through the hamlet and old cultivation terraces.

visits.text: Perched village at 700 m; medieval houses and paved streets.
Views over the Alps, Vercors and Ardèche high plateaus.
Traces of enclosure and old gate opening onto the ledge.

activities.text: Loop on the ridges and return via the lower village (4–6 km).
Short route through the alleyways to read the built fabric.

visits.text: Village on a meander of the Doux; Pont du Roi and stations of the cross.
Vivarois houses aligned on the main street and small squares.
Views over the Doux valley and bocage terraces.

activities.text: Riverside walk and bridge crossing for panorama (3 km).
Heritage route of facades, lintels and sculpted frames.

visits.text: Village overlooking the Eyrieux-Rhône confluence; schist and pebble lanes.
Upper quarter and remains of the fortifications, views over the Rhône corridor.
Access to major cycling routes Dolce Via and ViaRhôna (orientation).

activities.text: Panoramic walk between upper town and Eyrieux quay (2–3 km).
Introduction route on easy section of greenway (free round trip).

itineraries.title: LUBERON & MONTS DE VAUCLUSE: 15 HILLTOP VILLAGES

visits.text: Ansouis — hilltop village facing the Luberon, sloping streets and stone houses on rocky spur.
Château d'Ansouis — dominant silhouette over the Aigues valley (exteriors and esplanades).
Museum of Wine Arts and Crafts (at Château Turcan) — immersion from vine to glass.

activities.text: Walking loop among vineyards, olive trees and cherry trees at the foot of the village.
Southern viewpoints over the Aigues valley (heritage route).

visits.text: Lourmarin — artists' village with grey stones, shaded squares and plane tree avenue.
Château de Lourmarin (ext.) — Renaissance silhouette on the southern edge of Luberon.
Saint-André Church and Protestant temple — dual religious heritage (ext.).

activities.text: Strolling through the market (day according to season) and fountain trail.
Gentle walk towards the orchards and dry stone walls south of the village.

visits.text: Lacoste — hilltop village dominated by the Marquis de Sade's castle (restored in the 20th century).
Paved streets and medieval staircases leading to ramparts and viewpoints.
Art galleries and workshops scattered throughout the village.

activities.text: Climb to the castle plateau (panorama over Luberon and Calavon valley).
Walking on the stone-paved paths between terraces and retaining walls.

visits.text: Ménerbes — rocky spur in 'ship' formation, alleyways and viewpoints over scrubland and vineyards.
House of Truffle and Wine (ext./cultural route).
Clock Tower and ramparts (ext.) — reading the relief of the Luberon.

activities.text: Loop of belvederes on the north slope of the petit Luberon.
Path of wine terraces at the foot of the village.

visits.text: Oppède-le-Vieux — the most 'secret' medieval town of the Luberon, narrow cobbled streets and restored houses.
Romanesque church of Notre-Dame-d'Alydon and castle ruins (summit).

activities.text: Ascent via cobbled streets to the summit belvedere.
Nature trail towards terraces and old orchards north of the site.

visits.text: Goult — old village of the Agoult, narrow lanes, vaulted passages and small squares.
Jerusalem Mill (with sails) and plateau terraces (ext.).

activities.text: Heritage trail to the mill and the old oven.
Path between terraced fields, olive trees and vineyards (short loop).

visits.text: Roussillon — village of ochres, colorful facades at the foot of the former quarries.
Ochre cliffs and quarry faces (accessible areas).

activities.text: Walk in the pine forests and viewpoints over the Claparèdes plateau.

visits.text: Gordes — icon of Luberon, tiers of dry stone houses on the spur.
Viewpoints over the Calavon valley and the Monts de Vaucluse.

activities.text: Upper loop of the ramparts and castle esplanades (ext.).
Path towards viewpoints south of the village (panoramic shots).

visits.text: Fontaine-de-Vaucluse — spectacular resurgence at the foot of a limestone cliff.
Emerald water body under plane trees and banks of Sorgue.

activities.text: Round trip to the chasm (depending on water level).
Left bank path of the Sorgue (shaded portion).

visits.text: Murs — hilltop village on plateau, dominated by a castle with medieval remains (restored in the 20th century).
Village fabric: narrow streets, porches and views of wooded slopes.

activities.text: Ridge loop towards combes and isolated farms (karst landscape).
Oratories route on the edge of garrigue.

visits.text: Saint-Saturnin-lès-Apt — village rich in porches, fountains and sculpted doorways.
Ramparts and castle ruins on rocky spur (ext.).

activities.text: Ascent to the castle plateau and viewpoints over the Apt region.
Loop of cobbled streets and ornate facades of the center.

visits.text: Villars — round village approached by a shaded avenue, fountain and peaceful small squares.
Old center — traces of the fortified town and arched alleyways.

activities.text: Country walk towards hillsides and dry stone walls.
Photo route at sunset on the Claparèdes plateau.

visits.text: Caseneuve — isolated village on arid plateau, protected by a powerful castle (11th–13th c., Renaissance modifications).
Suburb route and open views over the Apt region.

activities.text: Loop on the plateau edge (heathland and lavender depending on season).
Identification of ancient drailles and clapas (stone piles).

visits.text: Viens — medieval fortified town with ramparts (11th–13th c.) and Clock Gate.
Narrow streets, tall houses and covered passages.

activities.text: Ramparts tower and belvedere over the Albion plateau.
Rural path to terraces and fields (short loop).

visits.text: Saignon — eagle's nest above Apt, cobbled alleys, gates and fountains.
Saignon Rock — impregnable belvedere over the Apt valley.

activities.text: Ascent to the rock by the stairs (360° view).
Route along the ramparts and the Clock Tower (ext.).

visits.text: Carry-le-Rouet — Côte Bleue resort: harbor, coastal road and coves with crystal-clear water.
Coastal road promontory — views of the calanques and Cap Couronne.

activities.text: Coastal walk along the corniche (easy round trip).
Swimming/snorkeling (depending on season) in a sheltered cove.

visits.text: Aix-en-Provence — Cours Mirabeau and small squares with fountains, private mansions.

activities.text: Cézanne's studio (exterior/depending on opening hours) and walk towards the Torse.

visits.text: Venelles — belvedere village north of Aix, views of Sainte-Victoire.
Old center — shaded streets and small squares.

activities.text: Wooded loop on the Venelles hills (marked trails).
Panoramic route at sunset towards the belvedere.

visits.text: Éguilles — perched village at the gates of Aix, blonde houses and ramparts (ext.).
High esplanades — views over the Berre lagoon and the Trévaresse chain.

activities.text: Heritage walk in the old center (cobbled streets, passages).
Scrubland paths on the edge of olive groves.

visits.text: Lambesc — historic town of the Aix region: private mansions and religious heritage (ext.).
Courtyards and fountains, memory of the États de Provence.

activities.text: Vine-olive loop on the Trévaresse hillsides.
Provençal market (depending on day) on the central avenue.

visits.text: Eyguières — eastern gateway to the Alpilles, at the foot of the limestone reliefs.
Historic center — fountains, passages and stone houses.

activities.text: Ridge trails (depending on level) towards the towers and oppida.
Discovery of orchards and olive groves in the plain.

visits.text: Eygalières — authentic perched village in the heart of the Alpilles Park.
Old church and keep (ext.) on the spur with views over olive groves.

activities.text: Loop of viewpoints around the old village.
Walk in the wine and olive-growing plain.

visits.text: Mollégès — plain town between Alpilles and Durance, bright facades and shaded squares.
Village heritage: church and old alleyways.

activities.text: Agricultural paths between hedges and orchards towards Saint-Andiol.

visits.text: Saint-Andiol — village of the Rhône corridor, straight streets and religious heritage.
Small squares and irrigation canal on the edge of farms.

activities.text: Countryside route towards the orchard-olive grove terroir.

visits.text: Châteaurenard — castle hill and lively town, between Avignon and Alpilles.
Top of the village — views over the Durance and market garden plains.

activities.text: Urban loop (Provençal market depending on day) and chapel circuit.

visits.text: Eyragues — village of Provençal tradition, tree-lined squares and alleyways.
Old center — rendered facades and fountains.

activities.text: Gentle cycling loop to Maillane (quiet roads).
Photo route of doorways and small squares.

visits.text: Maillane — birthplace of Frédéric Mistral, heart of literary Provence.
Village route: quiet streets and small squares.

activities.text: Path toward the agricultural landscapes of the Costières.

visits.text: Saint-Rémy-de-Provence — capital of the Alpilles: elegant alleyways, private mansions and art shops.
Ancient site of Glanum (ext.) and Saint-Paul cloister (ext.).

activities.text: Promenade along the boulevards and ramparts, viewpoints towards the Alpilles.
Tour of art workshops and galleries (selection).

visits.text: Les Baux-de-Provence — classified rocky spur, cobbled streets and seigneurial remains (ext.).

activities.text: Ascent to the viewpoints over the Arles plain.

visits.text: Le Paradou — medieval village between Baux and Maussane, narrow streets and fountains.
Heritage trail: wash houses, oratories and stone houses.

activities.text: Shaded walk along the irrigation canals.
Walking loop towards Maussane (one way possible).

visits.text: Maussane-les-Alpilles — olive-growing village at the foot of the ridges, heart of the valley.
Central square and fountain, southern facades.

activities.text: Olive groves-vineyards walk on agricultural tracks.
Discovery of oil mills (ext./depending on opening hours).

visits.text: Mouriès — France's leading olive-growing commune: Provençal town at the foot of the hills.
Center — small squares and rows of olive trees.
Saint-Martin-de-Crau — town of the stony plain, unique steppe ecosystems.
Museum route/Crau house (ext.) and service canals.

activities.text: Naturalist observation on trails (according to regulations).

visits.text: Arles — city of Art and History, Roman/Romanesque ensemble classified UNESCO (ext.).
Luminous old center: squares, private mansions and quays of the Rhône.

activities.text: Classical Roman walking routes (amphitheater, theater, Alyscamps ext.).
Stroll on the quays at sunset.

visits.text: Fontvieille — village of quarries and mills, living traditions.
Stone quarries (ext.) and buildings in blonde limestone.

activities.text: Discovery of capitelles and oratories (according to circuit).

visits.text: Saint-Étienne-du-Grès — gateway to the Alpilles between Crau and piedmont, peaceful village.
Side streets and small squares away from traffic flows.

activities.text: Agricultural paths toward the foothills (view of ridges).

visits.text: Tarascon — Rhône town, fortress castle on the river (ext.).
Old center: narrow streets, squares and private mansions.

activities.text: Walk along the banks of the Rhône and views of Beaucaire.
Route of the ramparts and medieval gates (exterior).

visits.text: Saint-Pierre-de-Mézoargues — small Rhône commune with preserved tranquility.
Rural framework: farms, orchards and irrigation canals.

activities.text: Countryside walking loop between hedges and orchards.
Observation on dike (view of the river corridor).

visits.text: Boulbon — village with narrow streets below the castle (ext.).
Small squares and vaulted passages at the foot of the hill.

activities.text: Ascent to the castle promontory (view of Rhône and Alpilles).

visits.text: Barbentane — between Avignon and Arles, village above the Rhône, wealthy heritage.
Old center and belvederes over plain and Durance.

activities.text: Walk along the edge of the Montagnettes (pine forests).
Tour of private mansions and carved doors (ext.).

itineraries.title: FORCALQUIER & VERDON REGION: 15 VILLAGES BETWEEN LAVENDER FIELDS, CITADELS AND GORGES

visits.text: Entrevaux — medieval city fortified by Vauban: gates, ramparts and drawbridge over the Var.
Old town — narrow streets, small squares and Provençal fountains.
Citadel (exteriors and panoramic ascent via the zigzag path).

activities.text: Arrival by the Pignes Train (tourist section) and stroll along the platforms.
Photo tour of the enclosures and viewpoints above the Var valley.

visits.text: Annot — medieval town that has remained authentic, tall houses, narrow streets and vaulted passages.
Sandstone quarter — chaos of blocks and woodland paths.

activities.text: Climbing and bouldering on the sandstone (equipped sites) or hiking the sandstone circuit.
Round trip on the steam Pignes Train (according to schedule).

visits.text: Castellane — lively Provençal town, remains of fortifications, posterns and towers.
Notre-Dame du Roc (ext.) — promontory overlooking the Verdon.

activities.text: Whitewater sports on the Verdon (rafting/canoeing depending on conditions).
Heritage walk in the old town and along the river.

visits.text: Colmars-les-Alpes — fortified town between Alpine and Provençal influences.
Forts and ramparts (exterior) guarding the entrance to the upper Verdon valley.

activities.text: Hiking in the Haut-Verdon valley (lakes, waterfalls, alpine pastures).
Tour of sundials and flowered squares.

visits.text: Seyne-les-Alpes — former fortified town (Vauban), ramparts and gates.
Esplanades and viewpoints over the Blanche valley.

activities.text: Fortress (educational heritage trail/escape game depending on opening).
Alpine walks (Grand-Puy station nearby depending on season).

visits.text: Cruis — village at the foot of Lure mountain, quiet alleys and local stone.
Church, cloister and traces of the former abbey.

activities.text: Walk through the olive groves and paths of lower Lure.

visits.text: Lurs — village on a balcony above a vast olive grove (AOC Aglandau).
Promenade des Évêques and viewpoints over the Durance.

activities.text: "Characters and typography" trail (Rencontres de Lure, graphic heritage).
Tasting of local olive oils (neighboring estates).

visits.text: Mane-en-Provence — golden stone village set on a hill of safre.
Citadel (ext.), priory, gardens and pointed huts around.

activities.text: Route of the calades and fountains in the town.
Heritage walk towards the ancient bridges and agricultural terraces.

visits.text: Simiane-la-Rotonde — perched village surrounded by lavender, private mansions and rampart remains.
Seigneurial rotunda (ext.) and belvedere over the Albion plateau.

activities.text: Route of the calades, carved doors, mullioned windows and hanging gardens.
Panoramic walk at the top of the village (view of lavandin fields).

visits.text: Saint-Michel-l'Observatoire — perched town with light facades, monumental fountain and upper church.
Astronomical center / Haute-Provence Observatory (historic scientific site).

activities.text: Sky observation evening (according to schedule) and chapel path.
Rural loop between terraced fields, mills and ramparts.

visits.text: Dauphin — Luberon village with ochre houses and numerous stone-paved streets.
Esplanade of the former castle — vast panorama over the Forcalquier region.

activities.text: Artisans' route and workshops open according to season.

visits.text: Montfuron — peaceful hamlet of 200 inhabitants, stone houses and century-old linden trees.
Windmill (1640) — one of the few still functional mills in the region (ext.).

activities.text: Ridge path above the village (views over Luberon and Durance).
Circuit of oratories and small church with square bell tower.

visits.text: Saint-Martin-de-Brômes — simple and charming Provençal village, flowered squares and fountains.
Ancient route on the Roman road (Gallo-Roman traces).

activities.text: Ridge path above the town for views over Verdon and plateaus.

visits.text: Riez-la-Romaine — ancient remains (temple columns), old baptistery and medieval heart.
Gypsum plasterwork route (molded plaster decorations) on remarkable facades and interiors.

activities.text: Heritage loop between private mansions, staircases and sculpted porches.
Walk towards the hills of Val d'Asse (view over plateaus).

visits.text: Moustiers-Sainte-Marie — classified village, built between two cliffs, suspended star and tiered narrow streets.
Notre-Dame-de-l'Assomption Church and earthenware museum (centuries-old craftsmanship).

activities.text: Ascent to Notre-Dame-de-Beauvoir (stairway) and belvedere overlooking Lake Sainte-Croix.
Tour of earthenware workshops/boutiques and walk to the Rion waterfalls.

itineraries.title: VILLAGES AROUND LAKE SAINTE-CROIX: TURQUOISE STOPOVER BETWEEN VERDON AND PROVENCE

visits.text: Les Salles-sur-Verdon — village rebuilt after the old site was submerged under the dam waters in 1973.
Discovery of the bell tower, fountain, old washhouses and war memorial, remnants of the vanished village.
Stroll through the new village with its flower-lined streets and revisited Provençal architecture.

activities.text: Walking tour to the lakeside and panorama of Costebelle Island.
Provençal market on Thursday morning and local products on the main square.
Water activities: paddleboard, pedal boat or windsurfing from the lake base.

visits.text: Aiguines — perched village overlooking Lake Sainte-Croix and the Verdon Gorges.
Renaissance château (private) with glazed tiles, panorama over the Valensole plateau and the Préalpes.
Saint-Pierre Chapel and orientation table with view over the lake and the Verdon ridges.

activities.text: Visit to the wood turning museum and local craft workshops.
Hiking on the D71 road (Verdon balconies) and viewpoints over the canyon.
Rock climbing on the Verdon walls or lounging on the lake beaches.

visits.text: Moustiers-Sainte-Marie — village classified among the most beautiful in France, famous for its earthenware and its star suspended between two rocky peaks.
Notre-Dame-de-l'Assomption Church and medieval heritage in the heart of the village.
Earthenware museum — collection tracing five centuries of Provençal ceramic art.

activities.text: Hike to the Notre-Dame-de-Beauvoir chapel for a view over the lake and the Verdon Gorges.
Discovery of earthenware workshops and shops (14 workshops and 22 stores).
Walk around the Rion waterfall or towards the Sainte-Madeleine cave.

visits.text: Bauduen — crescent-shaped village by the lake, typically Provençal with its narrow streets and stone houses.
Saint-Pierre-et-Saint-Paul church and Saracen tower of the village.
Ruins of the medieval castle overlooking Bauduen bay.

activities.text: 'Circuit de Bauduen' hike — panoramic loop around the lake (map available at the tourist office).
Swimming, sailing, canoeing or pedal boating on the village beaches.
Sunday market on the village square.

visits.text: Sainte-Croix-du-Verdon — village built on a rocky promontory at the exit of the Gorges du Verdon.
Picturesque old houses, flowered squares and 16th-century parish church.
Village belvedere — 180° panorama over the lake and surrounding mountains.

activities.text: Water sports center — windsurfing, kayak, pedal boat or sailing on the turquoise waters.
Hiking towards the hills overlooking the lake or sunset stroll on the pier.
Tuesday morning market and local products on the church square.

itineraries.title: THE 10 MOST BEAUTIFUL VILLAGES OF HAUT-VAR: JOURNEY BETWEEN CLIFFS, WATERFALLS AND BASTIDES

visits.text: Cotignac — village labeled 'Most Beautiful Village of France', nestled at the foot of a tufa cliff pierced with troglodyte dwellings.

activities.text: Walk to the troglodyte cliff and exploration of the rock site.
Provençal market on Tuesday morning — local products and local atmosphere.

visits.text: Sillans-la-Cascade — medieval village with cobbled streets and fortified castle.
Cascade de Sillans — 42-meter waterfall forming a turquoise lagoon, accessible by a forest trail.

activities.text: Walk through the undergrowth to the waterfall viewpoint (marked trail, 20 min).
Friday morning farmers' market (April to December).

visits.text: Entrecasteaux — picturesque village dominated by a 17th-century castle and its French gardens designed by Le Nôtre.
Saint-Sauveur Church and streets lined with Provençal fountains.

activities.text: Guided tour of the castle (according to schedule) and stroll in the gardens.
Friday morning market on the village square.

visits.text: Salernes — capital of ceramics, known for its production of hexagonal floor tiles.
Old town — Provençal streets, fountains and Roman bridge over the Bresque.

activities.text: Visit to a pottery workshop or the Terra Rossa museum.
Lively Sunday morning market on the central square.

visits.text: Correns — France's first organic village, nestled on the right bank of the Argens.
Old town — vaulted passages and golden stone facades.

activities.text: Walk in the Gorges de Bagarèdes and Vallon Sourn (shaded trails).
Monthly organic market in May (agricultural products and plants).

visits.text: Fox-Amphoux — twin village: Fox in the plain and Amphoux perched, connected by a panoramic road.
12th-century feudal castle (exteriors) and panorama over the hills of Haut-Var.

activities.text: Walk among olive groves and lavender fields around Fox.

visits.text: Villecroze — medieval village with flower-lined streets and stone arcades.
Natural troglodytic caves and waterfall in the municipal park.

activities.text: Walk in the shaded park and its natural pools.
Thursday morning market under the plane trees.

visits.text: Tourtour — nicknamed the 'village in the sky', perched at 635 m altitude with panorama over green Provence.
Saint-Denis Church and flowered streets lined with art galleries.

activities.text: Stop at Place des Ormeaux around the central fountain.
Provençal market on Wednesday or Saturday morning.

visits.text: Châteaudouble — medieval village suspended above the Nartuby, with steep streets and old stones.
Belvedere over the river and panorama of the surrounding cliffs.

activities.text: Hiking on the trails around the Nartuby canyon.
Bird of prey observation from the village heights.

visits.text: Moustiers-Sainte-Marie — village perched between two cliffs, famous for its suspended star and traditional earthenware.
Church of Notre-Dame-de-l'Assomption and stepped streets with fountains.

activities.text: Visit to an earthenware workshop and artisan demonstration.
Hike to the chapel of Notre-Dame-de-Beauvoir (panoramic view of Lake Sainte-Croix).

itineraries.title: OCCITANIE: 13 MOST BEAUTIFUL VILLAGES — FROM THE LOT VALLEY TO THE PYRENEES

activities.text: Sunset over the ramparts of Cordes.

visits.text: Saint-Cirq-Lapopie — panorama over the Lot valley, fortified church.

visits.text: Haut-de-Cagnes — medieval town, small squares and viewpoints.

activities.text: Renoir Museum (Domaine des Collettes) — studio and olive grove (according to opening hours).

activities.text: Walk toward the Loup valley — stone walls, terraces and orchards.

Château de Gourdon (exterior) and gardens inspired by Le Nôtre.

activities.text: Gorges du Loup — stops at Saut du Loup and photo points (whitewater).
Paragliding sites in the vicinity (depending on aerology/club).

activities.text: Cool path along the Brague (departmental park).
Heritage trail through the village (doors, small squares).

Cap d'Antibes — coastal path (coves, rocks, pine trees).
Port Vauban — esplanades and panorama over the docks.

activities.text: Easy cycling loop Antibes ↔ Juan-les-Pins along the seafront.

Hiking on the Friedrich Nietzsche trail between Èze-sur-Mer and Èze-village.

visits.text: Cagnes-sur-Mer — Haut-de-Cagnes, Grimaldi castle and Renoir museum.

Cap d'Antibes — coastal path, coves and viewpoints.

Swimming at la Garoupe beach or in Juan-les-Pins.

itineraries.title: NORMANDY: 20 MOST BEAUTIFUL VILLAGES – BETWEEN SEA, SEINE AND BOCAGE

activities.text: Twilight walk around the port + sunset.

activities.text: Coastal GR trail (cliffs, pastures) — panoramic loop.

activities.text: Loops on the edge, lake & village.

itineraries.title: VAL-D’OISE, ÎLE‑DE‑FRANCE: IMPRESSIONIST VILLAGES, ROYAL ESTATES AND RIVERSIDE ESCAPES
itineraries.notes: Ten days linking Auvers‑sur‑Oise, Cergy-Pontoise and the Oise valley: Van Gogh’s last footsteps, Renaissance châteaux, abbeys and forest retreats, with easy RER access from Paris.

visits.text: Cergy — Stroll the Axe Majeur by Dani Karavan, a monumental 3‑km urban artwork aligned on the Oise with belvederes and a red footbridge; late‑20th‑century land art and urbanism.
Cergy-Pontoise — Discover the historic port of Cergy on the Oise, a trading hub revived with quays, cafés and towpath walks.
Pontoise — Old town ramparts and Saint‑Maclou Cathedral, a Flamboyant‑Gothic church (13th–16th c.) with fine carved portals.

activities.text: Sunset walk along the Oise towpath from Port Cergy; go at golden hour for reflections and quiet birdlife.
Taste local craft beer in Pontoise’s historic center; evening opening times vary, arrive after 18:00.

visits.text: Musée Pissarro, Pontoise — Impressionist collections in a 19th‑century villa overlooking the Oise; focus on Camille Pissarro and contemporaries.
Vieux Pontoise — Medieval lanes around the Mont Bélien with half‑timbered houses and painterly viewpoints.
Oise river banks — Bridges and islets that inspired 19th‑century plein‑air painters; gentle photography loop.

activities.text: Market tasting in Pontoise (morning hours); pick seasonal cheeses and baguettes for a riverside picnic.
Evening bistro crawl around Place Notre‑Dame; reserve for weekend nights.

visits.text: Auvers‑sur‑Oise — Château d’Auvers: immersive parcours on Impressionism and the 19th‑century Paris region; formal terraces above the valley.
Auberge Ravoux (Maison de Van Gogh) — Final room of Vincent van Gogh (1890) and documented ambiance of a village inn.
Église Notre‑Dame‑d’Auvers — Romanesque‑Gothic church made famous by Van Gogh’s painting; 12th–13th century volumes, listed monument.
Cemetery of Auvers — Graves of Vincent and Theo van Gogh under ivy; moving site above the wheatfields.

activities.text: Waymarked painters’ trail through the fields and the Oise bluffs; start mid‑afternoon to catch soft light.
Dinner on the village square; book terraces on weekends.

visits.text: L’Isle‑Adam — River resort heritage: Belle‑Époque bathing huts, sandy river beach and Oise bridges.
Forêt de L’Isle‑Adam — Oak and beech forest with signed hiking loops and bridleways.
Art‑deco villas — Riverside façades and ironwork balconies dating 1900–1930.

activities.text: Rent a canoe on the Oise (in season, 10:00–17:00) and paddle quiet backwaters.
Ice‑cream stop on the river promenade; evenings lively in summer.

visits.text: Écouen — Musée national de la Renaissance in Château d’Écouen, a 16th‑century palace with tapestries (including the famous David & Bathsheba) and decorative arts.
Parc du Château — Formal terraces and hunting forest perspectives typical of the French Renaissance.

activities.text: Guided focus on enamels and maiolica rooms (check museum schedules; closed Tuesdays).
Sunset viewpoint over the Plaine de France from the château steps.

visits.text: Enghien‑les‑Bains — Lakeside spa architecture; casino façade and Belle‑Époque bandstand on the boardwalk.
Spa heritage museum (if open) and lakeshore villas; eclectic styles from 1850–1930.

activities.text: Pedal a lakeside boat (spring–summer rentals until 18:00); quiet morning waters are best.
Evening show at the Enghien theater/casino (tickets required).

visits.text: Abbaye de Royaumont — 13th‑century Cistercian abbey with cloister, chapter house and landscaped grounds; major cultural festival venue.
Asnières‑sur‑Oise — Village lanes and riverside mills near the abbey estate.

activities.text: Attend a chamber‑music rehearsal or garden event (check calendar); respectful silence in cloister.
Tea room in the former monastic refectory (afternoon).

visits.text: La Roche‑Guyon — Cliff‑side château with medieval keep, troglodyte stair and 18th‑century salons; site on the Seine loop.
Seine valley viewpoints in Parc naturel régional du Vexin français; chalk hills and orchard landscapes.

activities.text: Walk the “sentier des crêtes” above the village for sweeping Seine panoramas; avoid after rain (slippery chalk).
Local cider tasting at a Vexin farm (pre‑book).

visits.text: Montmorency — Basilica of Saint‑Denys (12th–18th c.) and streets once frequented by Jean‑Jacques Rousseau.
Valmorency forest trails — Chestnut groves and classic viewpoints towards Paris.

activities.text: Rousseau’s House (Montmorency museum) when open; check seasonal hours.
Café terraces on Place du Marché; evening ambiance.

visits.text: Vexin villages loop — Wy‑dit‑Joli‑Village and Marines stone farms; rural Romanesque churches with sculpted portals.
Pontoise quarries (guided) — Underground limestone heritage (book official tours only).

activities.text: Farewell dinner on the Oise in Port Cergy; book riverside tables.

itineraries.title: TAHITI, MOOREA, BORA BORA & RAIATEA: LAGOONS, PEAKS AND MARAE
itineraries.notes: Island‑hopping across the Society Islands: markets and waterfalls on Tahiti, bays and ridges on Moorea, turquoise lagoon time on Bora Bora, and Polynesian heritage on Raiatea.

visits.text: Papeete — Municipal Market (early morning) for vanilla, monoï and island produce.
Paofai Gardens — Waterfront promenade and outrigger canoes at sunset.

activities.text: Street‑food dinner at roulottes on Place Vaiete (open evenings).

visits.text: Tahiti east coast — Faarumai waterfalls and Arahoho blowhole; lush basalt valleys.
Museum of Tahiti and the Islands (if open) for cultural grounding.

activities.text: Short black‑sand beach swim; heed local currents and flags.

visits.text: Ferry to Moorea — Opunohu and Cook’s bays landscapes and pineapple fields.
Belvédère d’Opunohu — Ridgeline view over twin bays and Mount Rotui.

activities.text: Snorkel with garden fish at a public beach; mornings offer clearer water.

visits.text: Moorea ridge — Three Coconuts Pass hike through mape forests; panoramic saddle.
Tiki Village (evening show) or local dance rehearsal (community schedule).

activities.text: Cooking class: poisson cru with lime and coconut milk.

visits.text: Flight to Bora Bora — Lagoon viewpoints during approach; check left‑side seating.
Matira area — Public beach curve and shallow turquoise shelf.

activities.text: Lagoon tour by boat with coral gardens and stingray viewing (respect wildlife distances).

visits.text: Mount Otemanu viewpoints — Short motu landings for classic postcard frames.
WWII sites — Old coastal guns and supply base traces on the main island.

activities.text: Sunset outrigger ride; book for golden hour.

visits.text: Flight to Raiatea — Uturoa market and waterfront.
Marae Taputapuātea — UNESCO sacred complex of the Polynesian triangle; basalt marae facing the ocean.

activities.text: Kayak the Faaroa River, Polynesia’s only navigable river (guided).

visits.text: Day trip to Taha’a — Vanilla plantations and lagoon motus shared with Raiatea.

activities.text: Drift‑snorkel over coral gardens between motus (experienced swimmers only).

visits.text: Flight back to Tahiti — West‑coast lookout at Taharuu black‑sand beach.
Arahoho or local surf break viewing (respect no‑swim zones).

activities.text: Evening roulottes round 2 — sample raw‑fish plates and chevrettes.

visits.text: Free morning for crafts and last lagoon dip; airport transfer.

activities.text: Optional hike to Fautaua Valley waterfall (permit sometimes required; check conditions).

itineraries.title: RÉUNION ISLAND: GRAND CIRQUES, LAVA DESERTS AND LAGOON BEACHES
itineraries.notes: A clockwise loop from Saint‑Denis across Salazie, Cilaos and the volcano plains, mixing UNESCO‑listed landscapes, Creole heritage and the west‑coast lagoon.

visits.text: Saint‑Denis — Barachois waterfront cannons and Creole townhouses on Rue de Paris (19th c.).
Jardin de l’État — Botanical collections and natural‑history museum in a colonial garden.

activities.text: Evening cari and rhum arrangé tasting; book a table on Rue Maréchal Leclerc.
Short seaside jog on the Barachois promenade at sunrise.

visits.text: Saint‑Paul market (Fri–Sat) — Spices, fruits and Creole street food.
Maïdo road — Belvedere over the Mafate cirque; panoramas at 2190 m (arrive at sunrise).
Savanna distillery — Rum tasting and botanical garden (check hours).

activities.text: Lagoon snorkeling at l’Ermitage (inside reef only; heed lifeguard flags).
Paragliding over the lagoon (weather‑dependent; certified operator only).

visits.text: Salazie — Voile de la Mariée waterfalls and fern canyons; viewpoints along RD48.
Hell‑Bourg — Restored Creole villas (Maison Folio) and village museum.

activities.text: Easy loop hike around Hell‑Bourg (2–3 h, early start to avoid clouds).
Cassava cake and bonbon piment tasting in a village snack.

visits.text: RN5 to Cilaos — Road of 400 bends, basalt cliffs and tunnels; scenic stops at Îlet à Cordes viewpoint.
Cilaos — Thermal heritage, embroidery workshop and Cirque panoramas.
Cirque de Cilaos — Day hike on the Bras Rouge sector; basalt pools and cascades.
Village craft center — Lace and lentil products from the plateau.

activities.text: Short hike to La Roche Merveilleuse belvedere (late afternoon light).
Spa soak or wine tasting (local chenin/viognier micro‑production).
Optional summit attempt to Piton des Neiges (very early start; experienced hikers).

visits.text: Étang‑Salé — Black‑sand beach and petrified lava cliffs.
Saint‑Pierre — Waterfront market and Creole temple façades on Rue des Bons‑Enfants.

activities.text: Snorkel the protected lagoon (when sea is calm; never swim outside marked area).

visits.text: Plaine des Cafres — Volcano Museum (Cité du Volcan) introducing Piton de la Fournaise.
Plaine des Sables — Lunar ash plains on the access road to the volcano.

activities.text: Star‑gazing session (clear nights) on the high plateau; bring warm layers.

visits.text: Piton de la Fournaise — Hike from Pas de Bellecombe to the caldera rim with views of Dolomieu crater.
Grand Brûlé — Coastal lava flows and N2 road segments rebuilt over recent eruptions.

activities.text: Stop at Notre‑Dame des Laves chapel near Piton‑Sainte‑Rose.

visits.text: Back to Saint‑Denis — Street art lanes and last Creole boutiques.

activities.text: Final seaside walk at Barachois; airport drop‑off.

itineraries.title: WALLIS & FUTUNA: CRATER LAKES, MARAE AND REEF‑RINGED LAGOONS
itineraries.notes: Time on Uvea (Wallis) around crater lakes and marae, then hop to Futuna for rugged coasts and traditional villages.
